unit_learning_outcomes.description: Understand international relations - students should have a broad and nuanced understanding of the (sub-) discipline of International Relations, as content and as a field of study
Produce and submit a completed academic journal article - enhanced knowledge and understanding of academic practice in the discipline of International Relations
Engage with the craft of scholarship - choose a topic, decide an approach or method, organize and compose an article
Make sense of literature, discover journals, detect and comprehend approaches and arguments in relevant scholarly literature, land learn about positioning in the field

assessments.description: 6000-8000 word paper, composed in the form of a refereed journal article

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
Session 1, Fully online/virtual
data.subject_search_title: POIR7001 - Key Questions in International Relations
data.description: This unit examines enduring and/or topical issues and themes in International Relations, relating them to a single assessment component, for which students can choose their own topic. Some weeks will focus practically on aspects of the assessment component, a 6000-8000 word paper, composed in the form of a refereed journal article
